validOnEmptyField.description: Whether empty fields are treated as valid.
Whether empty fields are treated as valid.
Whether empty fields are treated as valid.
Whether empty fields are treated as valid.

({type:\"matchAgainstRegExp\";}&MatchAga.description:
Configuration for the different InputField validation strategies.
As the typescript compiler can't handle "correlated unions", it is recommended to defer to generics as described here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/79160004/can-typescript-infer-subtypes-of-parameters-based-on-a-dynamic-variable-accessin

ButtonComponentState.description:
The Button-component has to display a label. It may display a progress bar or a loading spinner.
It can be disabled on invalid input.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

loadingState.description: The loadingState of the button. If true, the button will display a loading spinner.

progressPercentage.description: The progress of the button. If set, the button will display a progress bar.

ButtonConfiguration.description: The ButtonConfiguration defines the look and behavior of the button.

dimensions.description: The dimensions of the button in pixels. Defaults to 100x50.

disableOnInvalid.description: Determines wether the button will be disabled if the validation fails.

icon.description: Additional icon for the button. Displayed to the left of the label.

innerComponentLayout.description: Some components may offer a customizable inner component layout. The layout is required to be built with CSS Grid.

CodeEditorComponentState.description: The CodeEditor-component may require state handling. This state is defined here.

code.description: The code-property is a string that contains the user's code.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

CodeEditorConfiguration.description: The CodeEditor-component may have configuration options. These options are defined here.

darkMode.description: The darkMode-property is a boolean that may be used to determine the dark mode of the CodeEditor.

innerComponentLayout.description: Some components may offer a customizable inner component layout. The layout is required to be built with CSS Grid.

language.description: The language-property is a string that may be used to determine the syntax highlighting of the CodeEditor.

CodeEditorValidationConfiguration<keyofC.description:
The CodeEditor allows for optional validation strategies.
The first strategy is a basic string compare.
The second strategy is a request-based strategy, which may depend on a user-defined strategy (e.g. test-suite, output comparisons, more complex string comparisons, etc.).
   As the second strategy may depend on more than just the code, the entire state is accessible.

ComparisonConfiguration.description: Configuration for basic comparison operations with static values.

ComponentAction.description: The serialized configuration of a component action.

ComponentActions.description: The serialized configuration for the actions of a component.

ComponentConfiguration.description: Component configuration. This holds possible configuration options for the component.

innerComponentLayout.description: Some components may offer a customizable inner component layout. The layout is required to be built with CSS Grid.

DotGraphComponentState.description: The DOTGraph-component may hold a static dotDescription in its componentData.

dotDescription.description: The dotDescription is a string, that holds the Graphviz-DOT description of the graph.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

FieldConfiguration.description:
The FieldConfiguration defines the properties of the InputField component.
It extends the QInputProps from Quasar.

autofocus.description: Focus field on initial component render

autogrow.description: Make field autogrow along with its content (uses a textarea)

bgColor.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

clearIcon.description: Custom icon to use for the clear button when using along with 'clearable' prop

clearable.description: Appends clearable icon when a value (not undefined or null) is set; When clicked, model becomes null

color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

counter.description: Show an automatic counter on bottom right

dark.description:
Notify the component that the background is a dark color
Default value: null

debounce.description: Debounce amount (in milliseconds) when updating model

error.description:
Does field have validation errors?
Default value: null

errorMessage.description: Validation error message (gets displayed only if 'error' is set to 'true')

fillMask.description: Fills string with specified characters (or underscore if value is not string) to fill mask's length

for.description: Used to specify the 'id' of the control and also the 'for' attribute of the label that wraps it; If no 'name' prop is specified, then it is used for this attribute as well

hideBottomSpace.description: Do not reserve space for hint/error/counter anymore when these are not used; As a result, it also disables the animation for those; It also allows the hint/error area to stretch vertically based on its content

hideHint.description: Hide the helper (hint) text when field doesn't have focus

hint.description: Helper (hint) text which gets placed below your wrapped form component

innerComponentLayout.description: Some components may offer a customizable inner component layout. The layout is required to be built with CSS Grid.

inputClass.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag

itemAligned.description: Match inner content alignment to that of QItem

label.description: A text label that will “float” up above the input field, once the field gets focus

labelColor.description: Color name for the label from the Quasar Color Palette; Overrides the 'color' prop; The difference from 'color' prop is that the label will always have this color, even when field is not focused

labelSlot.description: Enables label slot; You need to set it to force use of the 'label' slot if the 'label' prop is not set

lazyRules.description:
If set to boolean true then it checks validation status against the 'rules' only after field loses focus for first time; If set to 'ondemand' then it will trigger only when component's validate() method is manually called or when the wrapper QForm submits itself
Default value: false

loading.description: Signals the user a process is in progress by displaying a spinner; Spinner can be customized by using the 'loading' slot.

mask.description: Custom mask or one of the predefined mask names

maxlength.description: Specify a max length of model

name.description: Used to specify the name of the control; Useful if dealing with forms; If not specified, it takes the value of 'for' prop, if it exists

noErrorIcon.description: Hide error icon when there is an error

onClear.description: When using the 'clearable' property, this event is emitted when the clear icon is clicked

onUpdate:modelValue.description: Emitted when the component needs to change the model; Is also used by v-model

reactiveRules.description: By default a change in the rules does not trigger a new validation until the model changes; If set to true then a change in the rules will trigger a validation; Has a performance penalty, so use it only when you really need it

reverseFillMask.description: Fills string from the right side of the mask

rounded.description: Applies a small standard border-radius for a squared shape of the component

rules.description: Array of Functions/Strings; If String, then it must be a name of one of the embedded validation rules

shadowText.description: Text to be displayed as shadow at the end of the text in the control; Does NOT applies to type=file

square.description: Remove border-radius so borders are squared; Overrides 'rounded' prop

stackLabel.description: Label will be always shown above the field regardless of field content (if any)

standout.description: Use 'standout' design for the field; Specifies classes to be applied when focused (overriding default ones)

unmaskedValue.description: Model will be unmasked (won't contain tokens/separation characters)

FormActions.description: The FormComponent allows to emit a fetch-action on submitting the form.

FormComponentState.description: The Form-component has additional state properties for validation.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

FormNestedComponents.description: The Form-component consists of arbitrarily many input fields and a set of buttons.

formComponents.description: Components used as formComponents MUST expose their user input value as fieldValue in their componentState. See InputField for an example.

FormValidationConfiguration.description: The form-component is submitable if the validation checks that are governed by the FormValidationConfiguration are passed.

InputFieldComponentState.description: The InputField-component holds a fieldValue in its componentState.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

JSONPathExpression.description: The JSONPathExpression type is used to define a JSONPath expression.

LatexInputFieldComponentState.description: The InputField-component may hold a static input field value in its componentData.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

innerComponentLayout.description: Some components may offer a customizable inner component layout. The layout is required to be built with CSS Grid.

itemAligned.description: Match inner content alignment to that of QItem

If set to boolean true then it checks validation status against the 'rules' only after field loses focus for first time; If set to 'ondemand' then it will trigger only when component's validate() method is manually called or when the wrapper QForm submits itself

rounded.description: Applies a small standard border-radius for a squared shape of the component

rules.description: Array of Functions/Strings; If String, then it must be a name of one of the embedded validation rules

shadowText.description: Text to be displayed as shadow at the end of the text in the control; Does NOT applies to type=file

square.description: Remove border-radius so borders are squared; Overrides 'rounded' prop

stackLabel.description: Label will be always shown above the field regardless of field content (if any)

standout.description: Use 'standout' design for the field; Specifies classes to be applied when focused (overriding default ones)

unmaskedValue.description: Model will be unmasked (won't contain tokens/separation characters)

LatexInputFieldValidationConfiguration.description: Validation strategy that compares static values to the value of the input field.

MethodReference.description: A description of a user-facing method of a component.

MethodReferences.description: A map of method names and their descriptions.

NestedComponents.description: Possible nested components of a component. The components can be nested arbitrarily.

PathComparisonConfiguration.description: Configuration for basic comparison operations with dynamic values from paths.

SerializedBaseComponent<string>.description: Generic type description with defaults of a serialised base component.

actions.description: Optional: Actions that can be emitted by the component.

componentConfiguration.description: Configuration options that are specific to the individual component.

contextMenu.description: Optional: The context menu of the component.

isOpen.description: Specifies whether the context menu is open.

usedMethods.description: The methods that will be made available in the context menu.

methods.description: Optional: The methods of the component.

name.description: The name of the component instance. Will be displayed in the component header in CARPET.

nestedComponents.description: Optional: Nested components of the component.

isCorrect.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a correct state. Inputs are validated according to the components validation specification.

isValid.description: Specifices whether the user-inputs put the component in a valid state. Gives no indication of correctness of the inputs.

validationConfiguration.description: The validation configuration of the component.

SerializedButtonComponent.description: The SerializedButtonComponent interface is used to define the serialised properties of the Button component.

SerializedCodeEditorComponent.description: The SerializedCodeEditorComponent interface is used to define the serialised properties of the CodeEditor component.

name.description: The name of the component instance. Will be displayed in the component header in CARPET.

nestedComponents.description: Optional: Nested components of the component.

validationConfiguration.description: The validation configuration of the component.

SerializedCodeEditorDependencies.description: The CodeEditor-component requires the following dependencies. The paths to the dependencies are defined here via JSONPathExpression.

code.description: The code-property is a JSONPathExpression that may point to the user's code.

globalDarkMode.description: The globalDarkMode-property is a JSONPathExpression that may point to the user's dark mode preference.

referenceCode.description: The referenceCode-property is a JSONPathExpression that points to the reference code that the user's code will be compared against.

SerializedDOTGraphComponent.description: The SerializedDOTGraphComponent interface is used to define the serialised properties of the DOTGraph component.

actions.description: Optional: Actions that can be emitted by the component.

usedMethods.description: The methods that will be made available in the context menu.

methods.description: Optional: The methods of the component.

name.description: The name of the component instance. Will be displayed in the component header in CARPET.

nestedComponents.description: Optional: Nested components of the component.

validationConfiguration.description: The validation configuration of the component.

SerializedDOTGraphDependencies.description: The DOTGraph-component requires a valid dotDescription to display.

dotDescription.description: The dotDescription is a JSONPathExpression, that points to the dotDescription of the DOTGraph-component.

SerializedFormComponent.description: The SerializedFormComponent interface is used to define the serialised properties of the Form component.

actions.description: Optional: Actions that can be emitted by the component.

componentConfiguration.description: Configuration options that are specific to the individual component.

nestedComponents.description: Optional: Nested components of the component.

validationConfiguration.description: The validation configuration of the component.

SerializedFormDependencies.description:
The Form-component may point to external dependencies for validation checks.
The external dependencies must be references to other components.

SerializedInputFieldComponent.description: The SerializedInputFieldComponent interface is used to define the serialised properties of the InputField component.

SerializedInputFieldDependencies.description: The InputField-component may load its value from a reference value.
